pull.title: doc: mention bech32m/BIP350 in doc/descriptors.md
pull.body: As it says on the tin.

events.body: This may make sense for backport, but is extremely low priority.
ACK d2a09c83554cec864a27e704cf2a0d513691a567 - can be backported for coherent documentation. Bech32m support was backported into branches back to the 0.19.

issue.title: [22.x] Backports
issue.body:
Backports:
* #22847 - guix/prelude: Override VERSION with FORCE_VERSION
* #22837 - doc: mention bech32m/BIP350 in doc/descriptors.md

Theses are both minor enough that they would not require and rc4.

issue.title: [0.21] Final changes for 0.21.2
issue.body:
Backports:
* #22837 - doc: mention bech32m/BIP350 in doc/descriptors.md

issue.title: [0.20.2] rc3, (missing) release notes and backport
issue.body: This adds missing 0.20.0 and 0.20.1 release notes to the 0.20 branch, as well as release notes for 0.20.2, and backports #22837. The version is bumped to rc3 for the purpose of having one last, short, rc, before potentially cutting what should be the final release on the 0.20.0 branch.
